thesis.description: The ovary has been recognized as an endocrine organ for many years. This was established in many species, in classical fashion, by removing these organs and observing what occurred in the spayed animals (1). [...]
thesis.creator: Willoughby, Henry Wells.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Studies of ovary incubation and steroid constituents of the placenta from a mare treated with acetat-1-C14.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The organs of the adult animal may generally be divided into two broad groups on the basis of their mitotic activity. In one group, including liver, kidney or adrenal medulla, mitotic division of the parenchymal cells occurs very rarely. In the second group, comprising the hemopoietic tissue, gastric and intestinal mucosa, epidermis and other tissues, there are numerous dividing cells even in the mature animal. [...]
thesis.creator: Vulpe, Michel.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: The renewal of the epithelium of the urinary bladder.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The electrode shapes for a Pierce type electron gun as determined from an electrolytic tank have been inveatigated experimentally. The deterioration in performance for a known deviation of potential along the beam edge within the gun was measured. Pure tungsten wire spirals used as emitters were inveatigated using both D.C. and A.C. heater power and the effect of heater polarity on gun performance was measured. [...]
thesis.creator: Vessot, Robert Frederick Charles.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Electron guns.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This project is concerned with the recreational and social life of residents of a rapidly growing suburb of Montreal, the Town of St. Laurent. It studies the recreational and social activities engaged in by families and by individuals who live in a section of the town which has been developed since 1949. Data were obtained through interviews with persons living in a sample group of 75 households which were selected from the 300 households in this section of the Town. [...]
thesis.creator: Phillips, Lorna M.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: Recreation in the town of St. Laurent.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: There has recently been an increase of theoretical interest in the effects of early experience on behavior, together with an increasing number of experimental studies. In one area, however, there is a marked discrepancy between theoretical emphasis and amount of empirical investigation: the area of avoidance behavior, and pain. [...]
thesis.creator: Melzack, Ronald.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: The effects of early experience on the emotional responses to pain.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Since there is much evidence to indicate that many rapidly developing communities in Canada are not providing sufficient social and recreational opportunities for their citizens, a study of such provisions made by the rapidly developing community of St. Laurent was undertaken. [...]
thesis.creator: Faughnan, Jeanne.
Gabois, Denise.
Miller, Robert.
Romer, Gabrielle.
Faughnan, Jeanne.
Sinuk, Morris.
thesis.subject: Social Work.
thesis.title: A study of recreation in a rapidly developing community in Montreal.

thesis.description: The mine is located 6 miles east of the Town of Malartic, and is about 300 miles northwest of Montreal. A belt of altered peridotite about 2,500' wide trends southeasterly across the property. An embayment of talc-chlorite rock branches from the Cadillac fault, which forms the north contact of the peridotite, into the peridotite belt in a southeasterly direction. [...]
thesis.creator: Black, Philip Thomas.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The geology of Malartic Gold Fields mine, Halet, Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: During the past two decades, spray drying has experienced a spectacular industrial development. Simultaneously, a considerable amount of experimental investigation has been carried out to minimize the empirical nature of spray dryer design and provide a firmer theoretical background for it. The purpose of this historical survey is to summarize the work which has been done on spray drying, with special emphasis on the theoretical considerations governing the process and the design of the equipment. [...]
thesis.creator: Macrakis, Nicholas.
thesis.subject: Chemical Engineering.
thesis.title: Performance characteristics of a co-countercurrent spray dryer.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It has been known for some time that D-fructose condenses with cold methanol in the presence of hydrogen chloride to give a syrup consisting in the main of equal amounts of methyl α- and ß-D-fructofuranoside. Earlier workers have isolated a portion of the α-isomer as a pure, crystalline compound, but the ß-analogue has never been separated in the pure form. [...]
thesis.creator: Wood, John Charles.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Purifications and properties of methyl and benzyl-B-D-fructofuranosides and their tetraacetates.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The neurophysiology of respiration has been the subject of intensive investigation for well over a century. Early in this period it became apparent that the most fundamental respiratory centres were located within the brain stem, and that the activity of such centres was influenced directly or indirectly by humoral factors and by afferent stimuli from many sources including centres situated more rostrally in the central nervous system. [...]
thesis.creator: Baxter, Donald W.
thesis.subject: Neurology & Neurosurgery.
thesis.title: On the functional and anatomical organization of the neural respiratory mechanisms in the cat.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Stress-strain concepts and terminology are discussed, and definitions of basic terms given. The concepts of failure in the fields of Engineering, Soil Mechanics, and Geology are reviewed from a geological viewpoint. The conditions of rupture are discussed. Becker's (1893) paper is critically analyzed in the Appendix, and his principal conclusions are shown to be fallacious. [...]
thesis.creator: Averill, Edward Leonard.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Some aspects of stress-strain theories and their use in the interpretation of the fracture pattern in rocks.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Many substances have been used during the last three decades to influence the course of experimental arteriosclerosis. Amongst these choline and other lipotropic agents have occupied a prominent place. No uniform results have, however, been obtained in these researches, so that it was considered worthwhile to re-investigate the problem, employing the rabbit as experimental animal and choline, which is not only a potent lipotropic substance but also, because of its many physiological functions, a potentially important therapeutic agent. [...]
thesis.creator: Meissner, George F.
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: The influence of choline on experimental arteriosclerosis.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is not the intention to present in this report an extended history of the application of the disinfection process. Chick (1908), and Chick and Martin (1908 a,b) gave an excellent review of this subject. Wyss (1948) reviewed more recent developments. McCulloch (1946) has given an interesting historical account of the origin of the practice of disinfection. [...]
thesis.creator: Myers, Gordon Edward.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology.
thesis.title: An evaluation of certain principles of disinfection.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The main object of this work was to investigate the reaction of 2-bromo-2-nitro-1, 3-indandione with pyridine in order to elucidate the chemica1 character of the former compound and of the bromine atom in particular. From the previous publications of other workers it is known that the bromine atom is very active in 2-bromo-2-nitro-1, 3-indandione; therefore two possibilities could be foreseen in the interaction of the above named substances: first, the formation of a pyridinium salt with bromine as an anion, and second, the action of 2-bromo-2-nitro-1, 3-indandione as a brominating and an oxidizing agent on pyridine. [...]
thesis.creator: Metro, Stephen Joseph.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The Reaction of 2-bromo-2-nitro-1, 3-indandione with pyridine.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Although acetylcholine as a chemical substance was known as early as 1867 (14), it was not until the discovery of its powerful pharmacological effects by Hunt and Taveau (108), later extended by Dale (49) and others, that the compound attracted the attention of physiologists. [...]
thesis.creator: McLennan, Hugh.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Factors affecting the synthesis of acetylcholine by brain tissue preparations.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Present concepts of electrolyte and water metabolism, and the influence of the adrenal cortex on these important constituents of the body, have their origin in three main areas of observation: in the study of water metabolism, in the study of electrolyte metabolism, and in the study of the function of the adrenal cortex. [...]
thesis.creator: McGarry, Eleanor.
thesis.subject: Experimental Medicine.
thesis.title: Observations on body water and electrolytes following administration of ACTH in man.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A method is described for the study of fractional second activities induced in the cyclotron. A 0.28 sec. period induced in chromium at a threshold of approximately 12.5 Mev. has been assigned to Mn50. [...]
thesis.creator: Martin, William Macphail.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Short proton-induced activities in chromium and nickel.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: It is a principle of common law that if goods are shipped in a general ship (a) without any express contract being made between the shipper of the goods and the ship-owner or if a contract is made, one which does not contain any stipulations relieving the shipowner from liability for loss of/or damage to the goods, the shipowner acts as an insurer of their safety. [...]
thesis.creator: MacKay, Kenneth C.
thesis.subject: Civil Law.
thesis.title: The water carraige of goods act, 1936.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The development of a soil profile has been attributed to the acidic substances derived from the decomposition of the organic matter deposited naturally on the soil surface. That such substances actively engage in soil development has been concluded from examination of profiles in the field. [...]
thesis.creator: Lutwick, Laurence Everett.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Chemistry.
thesis.title: An investigation of interactions between leachates from decomposing leaves and soil forming materials.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The interest in dibenz (l,3)(a,c)cycloheptane and its derivatives developed as a result of two trends of investigation. One group of investigators was concerned with the extension of classical reactions which would produce cyclic structures.
thesis.creator: Lucien, Harold William.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: The synthesis and properties of dibenz (1,3)(a,c) cyclohepta-5, 7-dione.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis describes the design and construction of a reliable control device for a Wilson cloud chamber working in conjunction with a cyclotron. The problems which arise due to the intense magnetic field of the cyclotron, the necessity for reliable automatic operation of the chamber, and the exigencies of remote control, and their solutions, are discussed in detail. [...]
thesis.creator: Loomer, E. I.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: An automatic timing device to adapt a Wilson cloud chamber for use with a cyclotron.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The effect of genetic diversity on the combining ability of eight inbred lines of corn was investigated using 16 single and nine double crosses. Single crosses combining two dent or two flint inbreds were not significantly different from those combining a dent and a flint. [...]
thesis.creator: Loiselle, Roland.
thesis.subject: Agronomy.
thesis.title: Combining ability in corn inbreds.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The action of chlorine dioxide and of sodium chlorite, two new bleaching agents used to remove dark coloured lignin impurities from wood pulps, was studied on a wood lignin that had been isolated without much chemical change. Both oxidants produced similar results, converting the insoluble, presumably nonphenolic lignin first into alkali-soluble phenolic substances. [...]
thesis.creator: Levitin, Norman.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Oxidations of periodate lignin with sodium chlorite and chlorine dioxide.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The study of atherosclerosis has been pursued by men in many parts of the world with Churchillian tenacity. The literature published on the facts, and theories about this disease, can only be described as colossal. [...]
thesis.creator: Lautsch, Elizabeth V.
thesis.subject: Pathology.
thesis.title: The accumulation of colloidal substances in the lesions of experimental cholesterol atherosclerosis.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The construction of a pressure-insulated Van de Graaff generator for electron acceleration to give 500 kilovolts was undertaken at the National Research Council of Canada. The generator is of original design, although complying in the main with established principles. One of its features is the successful development of an insulator which seems a good solution thus far to the problem of a horizontal support. [...]
thesis.creator: Lam, Mathias.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: The development of a horizantal Van de Graaf generator.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
